data.title: based independent design and visual effects studio
data.meta_description: A collection of productions Phosphene™ have taken part in.
data.text:
Rustin

Netflix

Bayard Rustin, advisor to Martin Luther King Jr., faces racism and homophobia as he changes the course of Civil Rights history

Directed by George C. Wolfe

Nyad

Netflix

The true story of 60 year old Diana Nyad’s successful attempt at swimming from Cuba to Florida.

Directed by Jimmy Chin and Elizabeth Chai Vasarhelyi

A Murder at The End of the World

FX

When Darby arrives at a remote retreat, a terrible crime awaits her. As one of the guests is found dead, she must use her hacking and detective skills to prove the murder before the killer strikes again.

Created by Zal Batmanglij and Brit Marling

Maestro

Netflix

The story of composer Leonard Bernstein and his wife Felicia Montealegre over 30 years.

Directed by Bradley Cooper

White Noise

A24

A suburban family’s life is disrupted by a nearby chemical leak, forcing them to evacuate their peaceful neighborhood.

Directed By Noah Baumbach

The Whale

A24

An anti social English teacher attempts to connect with his estranged teenage daughter.

Directed By Darren Aronofsky

The Pale Blue Eye

Netflix

A retired detective sets off to uncover the truth behind a series of murders, he enlists the help of a young cadet turned famous author known as Edgar Allen Poe.

Directed By Scott Cooper

Tick, Tick… Boom!

Netflix

With his 30th birthday looming, a young theater composer navigates love, friendship and the pressures of being an artist in New York City.

Directed By Lin-Manuel Miranda

The Marvelous Mrs. Maisel

Amazon

A Jewish Housewife living in the 1950’s setting out to become a comedian in New York City.

Created By Amy Sherman-Palladino

Succession

HBO

The story of a dysfunctional American global-media family.

Created By Jesse Armstrong

In the Heights

Warner Bros. Pictures

A feature version of the broadway musical, a bodega owner contemplates closing his store and retiring to the Dominican Republic after he inherited his grandmothers fortune.

Directed By Jon M. Chu

Last Week Tonight

HBO

American late night talk and news satire television program

Created By John Oliver

The Gilded Age

HBO

A young aspiring writer moves from rural Pennsylvania to New York City after the death of her father to live with her old-money aunts, Marian inadvertently becomes immersed in a social war between her new neighbors as she is exposed to a modern age.

Created By Julian Fellowes

See

Apple Tv+

In the very distant future, humans have lost their sense of sight, then the father of twins are born with the ability to see and must protect the tribe against a threatened queen.

Created By Steven Knight

The Time Traveler’s Wife

HBO

The seemingly normal love story of Henry and Clare that has one special secret; time travel

Created By Steven Moffat

WeCrashed

Apple Tv+

A love story centered around the quick rise and even quicker fall of WeWork, a valuable startup.

Created By Lee Eisenberg and Drew Crevello

Dexter: New Blood

Showtime

A continuation of the tv show Dexter, the world believes Dexter Morgan died. Living under a false name in a small town called Iron Lake, NY, he’s successfully tamped down his Dark Passenger for nearly 10 years. With a job and girlfriend, life seems to completely normal – until his son shows up. Dexter falls back to his homicidal urges and soon finds himself on involved with a very dangerous local.

Created By Clyde Phillips

We Own This City

HBO

Based on the novel, this drama film follows the rise and fall of the Baltimore Police Department’s Gun Trace Task Force. It exposes the corruption and fall of the American city’s policies of drug prohibition and mass arrest are championed at the expense of actual police work.

Directed By Reinaldo Marcus Green

The Survivor

HBO

After being sent to Auschwitz, Harry Haft is forced to participate in a boxing match along with fellow prisoners.

Directed By Barry Levinson

Judas and the Black Messiah

Warner Bros. Pictures

When Fred Hampton becomes a Chairman of the Illinois chapter of the Black Panther Party, it puts him in directly in the crossfire of the FBI, government, and police.

Directed by Shaka King

Stillwater

Focus Features

A father journeys from Oklahoma to France to help his estranged daughter, who is in prison for a murder she claims she didn’t commit.

Directed by, Tom McCarthy

City on a Hill

SHOWTIME

In the early 1990’s, ADA Decourcey Ward and corrupt FBI veteran Jackie Rohr work as a team to change the entire criminal justice system of Boston.

Created by Chuck MacLean

False Positive

Hulu

After finally becoming pregnant, Lucy begins to uncover the unsettling truth about her dream fertility doctor.

Directed by John Lee

The Stand

Paramount+

Due to a man made plague, the world is in ruins and is suffering an elemental struggle between good and evil.

Developed by Ben Cavell and Josh Boon

The Devil All The Time

Netflix

Sinister characters cross a young man devoted to protecting those he loves in a town full of corruption and brutality.

Directed by Antonio Campos

The Plot Against America

HBO

U.S. citizens living in an alternative history in which Franklin D. Roosevelt loses the 1940 presidential election to Charles Lindbergh.

Created by Ed Burns and David Simon

The Hunters

Amazon

A group of Nazi hunters living in 1977 New York City discover Nazi war criminals that are plotting a 4th Reich in the U.S.

Created by David Weil

Escape At Dannemora

SHOWTIME

A prison worker in upstate New York helps a pair of inmates escape after becoming romantically involved with them both.

Directed by Ben Stiller

Set It Up

Netflix

Two corporate assistants in New York City attempt to set up their high-strung bosses.

Directed by Claire Scanlon

Fahrenheit 451

HBO

In a dystopian future where books are illegal, a conflicted fireman begins reading in secret while uncovering a resistance dedicated to saving literature. Based on the novel by Ray Bradbury.

Directed by Ramin Bahrani

Paterno

HBO

After becoming the winningest coach in college football history, Penn State’s Joe Paterno must deal with the aftermath of the Jerry Sandusky sexual abuse scandal.

Directed by Barry Levinson

The Looming Tower

Legendary Television

A controversial look at the CIA and FBI’s successes and failures leading up to the events which took place on 9/11.

Directed by Craig Zisk and Michael Slovis

Hostiles

Waypoint Entertainment

The journey of a Cheyenne chief and his family as they are escorted through dangerous territory.

Directed by Scott Cooper

The Greatest Showman

Twentieth Century Fox

A musical starring Hugh Jackman as P.T. Barnum, a visionary entertainer who drew together a band of outcasts and misfits to create a world-famous show in celebration of the diverse and the unique.

Directed by Michael Gracey

The Sinner

USA

A young mother searches to overcome her inexplicable and startling acts of violence.

Directed by Derek Simonds

It Comes At Night

A24

While an unnatural threat leaves the world with few survivors, two families are forced to share a desolate home to keep the outside evil at bay.

Directed by Trey Edward Shults

The Deuce

HBO

A dive into 1970’s and 80’s New York City during the pioneering moments of what would become the billion-dollar American sex industry.

Created by George Pelecanos and David Simon

The Only Living Boy in New York

Amazon Studios

Seamlessly wandering through post-graduate life, Thomas Webb’s life is turned inside out by his father’s mistress.

Directed by: Marc Webb

The Immortal Life of Henrietta Lacks

HBO

Many years after an African-American woman’s cancer cells were taken without her knowledge; a writer, Rebecca Skloot, uncovers the secrets and lies of how Henrietta Lacks’ cells changed the world of medicine forever.

Directed by George C. Wolfe

The OA

Netflix

The mind-bending mystery of Prairie Johnson raises questions about her whereabouts when she suddenly reappears after 7 years.

Directed by Zal Batmanglij

How to Talk to Girls at Parties

See-Saw Films

An alien from another galaxy meets two young inhabitants of the most dangerous place in the universe: the London suburb of Croydon.

Directed by John Cameron Mitchell

Girl on the Train

Dreamworks SKG, Amblin Entertainment

The Girl on the Train is the story of Rachel Watson’s life post-divorce. Every day, she takes the train passed her old life. What she thinks she may have seen through the window, could change everything.

Directed by Tate Taylor

Mr. Robot

USA

Mr. Robot follows Elliot, a programmer with questionable mental health, who works as a cyber-security engineer by day and a vigilante hacker by night.

Created by Sam Esmail
